metaphor.core: Alice's changing size and encounters in Wonderland serve as a metaphor for conditional rendering in React, illustrating how different UI elements are displayed or hidden based on specific conditions, state, or props, and the importance of rendering only what is needed.

mapping.reactConcept: Component state determining which UI elements are rendered

mapping.fictionElement: Tiny door only accessible when Alice is small
mapping.reactConcept: Conditional rendering of UI elements based on a boolean condition (using `&&` operator)
Conditionally mounting/unmounting components from the DOM

mapping.fictionElement: Trying to be two sizes at once (painful distortion)
mapping.reactConcept: Anti-pattern of rendering all possible UI states and hiding them with CSS, leading to inefficient rendering and potential layout issues

mapping.fictionElement: The Cat's Logic: 'Choose one path, and one path only.'
mapping.reactConcept: Using ternary operators for mutually exclusive conditional rendering

mapping.fictionElement: Mad Hatter's tea party (empty cups rendered for absent guests)
mapping.reactConcept: Inefficient conditional rendering where elements are always in the DOM but hidden

mapping.fictionElement: Alice's conditional tea party (only present guests rendered)
mapping.reactConcept: Efficient conditional rendering by filtering and rendering only truly present components
Managing complex, nested conditional logic in React components

metaphor.narrativeArc: The module follows Alice's journey through Wonderland, encountering situations that naturally map to conditional rendering challenges: from simple showing/hiding elements based on her size, to the pitfalls of trying to render conflicting states, and finally to mastering efficient conditional logic, culminating in understanding complex nested conditions at the Queen's court.

chapters.title: The Hall of Shifting Doors
chapters.focus: Introduction to conditional rendering: showing/hiding elements based on state or boolean conditions (&& operator).

chapters.title: A Most Awkward Predicament
chapters.focus: Demonstrates the anti-pattern of rendering conflicting UI states simultaneously and the problems it causes.

chapters.title: The Cat's Logic
chapters.focus: Introduces clean, mutually exclusive conditional rendering using the ternary operator for choosing between different component branches.

chapters.title: A Tale of Two Tea Parties
chapters.focus: Compares efficient (rendering only what's present) versus inefficient (rendering and hiding) conditional list rendering.

chapters.title: The Queen's Conditional Court
chapters.focus: Explores managing and structuring complex, nested conditional logic in React components.

interactiveElements: Simulating Alice's size changes to access different 'doors'
Demonstrating the 'distortion pain' of inefficient anti-patterns
Comparing efficient vs. inefficient tea party guest rendering
Manipulating conditions at the Queen's Court to see dynamic verdicts
